editorialNotes.short: Something's very wrong here. Can you make it through the night?

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: A hugely ambitious action blockbuster, Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas is filled with sharp satire, fascinatingly flawed characters, and a huge variety of ways to play. Explore the cities and countryside of a vividly realized fictional version of the southwestern United States. You can tackle story-driven quests, gorge on fast food, outrun the police, or obey every traffic lightâ€”itâ€™s up to you. This enormous game deftly displays Rockstarâ€™s unique mastery of open-world design, and it never fails to entertain.

The unstoppable, poppable Bloons series gets better with each installment, and this entry in the cute-but-cunning tower-defense franchise is no exception. Bloons TD 5 is adorable and quirky, but thereâ€™s an astonishing amount of content, tactical depth, and replayability to go along with the goofy weapons, helium-filled interlopers, and priceless monkey business.

editorialNotes.tagline: Don't let the zombies stop you
Ollie and flip for high scores
editorialNotes.standard: Sure, there are skateboarding games that let you pull 900s from telephone wires, then land in a manual, collecting millions of points. But when you want realism and complexity, you want True Skate. For years, True Axisâ€™ skateboarding simulator has been letting us ollie, grind, and kickflip with our fingers. Competing with your friends, scouting gaps, and completing missions is great fun, but the true reward is perfecting a line and nailing incredible tricks with just the right swipes.
The latest in this gorgeous, long-running tower defense series adds cool twists, like playing with two heroes at once.

Tiny Wings has been a longtime favorite of ours, thanks to its gentle vibe, fantastic music, and surprisingly awesome one-touch gameplay. Outrunning the sun across procedurally generated islands is rewarding and relaxing, and we love the added challenge of the four-bird race mode. The gameâ€™s vivid, vibrant colors absolutely dazzle on Apple TVâ€”we feel like weâ€™re meeting our flightless friends for the first time again.
Follow the story of the acclaimed animeâ€”or hop straight into battle as your favorite heroesâ€”in the action-packed mobile version of the 2008 fighting game.

Dead Cells is a celebration of perseverence: In this game, death is never final, but an essential learning tool. With every new run through ever-changing, enemy-infested levels, you get a little stronger and a little more skilled at overcoming relentless adversariesâ€”and gradually overcome obstacles that once felt insurmountable. The acclaimed roguelike platformer makes all rewards feel earned; you'll be motivated to to brush off mistakes and charge back into battle again and again.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: While Hitman GO carved out a bold new direction for Agent 47, his next iOS mission expertly captures the riveting gameplay of the venerable console series. You wonâ€™t be donning disguises to sneak into enemy compounds (the gameâ€™s all about sniping), but you still carefully scout each location, unravel the intricately woven level design, and then strike with impeccable timingâ€”or die and try again. Hitman: Sniper does its legacy proud with 150 missions full of engrossing action and the seriesâ€™ quirky sense of humor.
Mash through waves of foes as a heavily armed potato in this spud-tacular arena survival game.

editorialNotes.tagline: Clean up Gotham one brick at a time
editorialNotes.standard: Warner Bros. continues its tradition of App Store excellence with this clever bite-sized brawler, which mashes up the family-friendly LEGO brand with a classic comic-style good vs. evil story. Whether you take up Batman's cape and cowl or step into the shoes of a number of other Justice League heroes, saving Gotham City is a charming adventure for gamers of all ages.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: The concept behind Kingdom Rush Frontiers is exceptionally simple: take the same great ideas, visual style, and fiendishly difficult tower defense that millions fell in love with in the original game and improve it by adding tons of incredible content. Frontiers packs new heroes, settings, towers, and tons of fresh enemies to fend off, making the frenzied action even harder to put down.

editorialNotes.tagline: Put an end to the terror

editorialNotes.standard: In this gorgeous twist on the infinite runner, you guide an agile snowboarder down a never-ending mountain, pulling off backflips over icy chasms and grinding along rooftops in sleepy villages. Simple one-finger controls make it instantly accessible, but tackling each levelâ€™s trio of challenges requires deft reflexes. With its exquisitely rendered visuals, soothing music, and finely tuned gameplay, Altoâ€™s Adventure is simultaneously serene and exciting.
editorialNotes.short: We're obsessed with nailing the perfect run while admiring the gorgeous scenery.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.tagline: A classic that never gets old

editorialNotes.short: Explore endless vertical worlds controlling a four-legged alien.
editorialNotes.standard:
One of the App Storeâ€™s early sensations, Doodle Jump has only improved with age. 

The superbly simple gameplay remains: tilt your device to hop up an endless series of platforms, blasting bad guys, grabbing power-ups, and making your mark on a global leaderboard. Hand-drawn visuals add quirky appeal, while an evolving mix of doodled worlds, special items, and whimsical characters keep this indie classic fresh.

Limbo is a gripping blend of stark, haunting landscapes, bizarre characters, and unsettling sounds. With clever puzzle design, an intriguing narrative, and an excellent touch-screen control system, itâ€™s as rewarding to play as it is interesting to look at and listen to.
editorialNotes.short: Dark, haunting, beautiful. This'll stay with you long after it's over.

editorialNotes.standard: Pencil in time for nostalgic cannon duels in this hand-drawn reimagining of an old-school classic, where cannonballs fly while scribbled tumbleweeds bounce across graphite landscapes.

Badland is an eerie sidescroller in which you guide a nondescript creature through creepy and perilous environments. Thanks to simple controls and obvious objectives, the game is instantly accessible, but winding levels and unique power-ups make each stage an exercise in careful timing and hasty strategies. As the gameplay evolves and becomes increasingly bizarre, Badland remains incredibly fun.

ios.subtitle: Itâ€™s not a bug, itâ€™s a feature

editorialNotes.standard: Prove your penitence by parrying snakes with oversize fangs in this bleak but beautiful platformer.
Talk about wild family outings! Help the Bergson bunch battle evil in this gorgeous throwback RPG.

editorialNotes.tagline: Can you become king of the hill?

editorialNotes.standard: Frogmindâ€™s follow-up to our 2013 iPad Game of the Year has our minds in apocalyptic overdrive. We canâ€™t stop thinking about all the whirring blades, crushing boulders, and other deathtraps you have to fly, fall, and roll through. The physics-based puzzles are even more clever this time around, flowing from one to the next in sprawling, eerily beautiful levels laced with dread. Badland 2â€™s elegant controls and frequent checkpoints make it easy to pick up and love, but its wealth of missions and online challenges will wow even the most hardcore players.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: A well is usually one of the last things weâ€™d want to fall into, but this retro-style shooter has us jumping in again and again. Itâ€™s a rush descending from rock to rock, blasting creepy creatures with your gunboots while nabbing crimson gems. Roguelike difficulty means youâ€™re in for a challenge, but superb controls and nifty upgrades (including a jetpack, a drone, and laser sights) give you all the help youâ€™ll need. And with randomly generated levels, each journey feels as fresh and exciting as the last.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Wage wacky turn-based warfare in this sequel to the classic strategy game. New troop classes offer all-new combat options, while a flexible card system lets you unleash special powers to enhance your squadâ€™s abilities. Packing rich multiplayer mayhem, an explosive single-player campaign, and endless quirky charm, itâ€™s the best Worms yet.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Randomly generated levels keep every punishing platforming challenge fresh as you dash to save your kid.

name: Way of the Hunter Wild America

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Deliver packages to rebuild a ravaged societyâ€”and unravel supernatural mysteriesâ€”in this wild post-apocalyptic adventure crafted by legendary game maker Hideo Kojima.

Youâ€™re a goat, free to run wild and cause mayhem in a virtual town. And trust us: that premise leads to tons of hilarious moments and stunts. Weâ€™ve crashed parties, head-butted cars, bounced on trampolines, and done a million other goofy things in this outrageous sandbox game.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Catchy music, incredible combo-filled combat, co-op play, and a blast of nostalgic spirit ensures this classic brawling series still packs a punch.

Set in a snowy Nordic fantasy world, Bad North is about doing the best you can with what youâ€™ve got. Command troops of archers, swordsmen, and more as you protect a chain of islands from marauders, but one wrong move can prove costly. Tense, slick, and stylish, Bad North is a heady blend of tactical combat, strategic planning, and intuitive controls.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.tagline: Classics never go out of style
